sanskrit_verse:
नाग्निं मुखेनोपधमेन्नग्नां नैक्षेत च स्त्रियम् ।
नामेध्यं प्रक्षिपेदग्नौ न च पादौ प्रतापयेत् ॥ ४.५३॥
transliteration:
nāgniṁ mukhenopadhamennagnāṁ naikṣeta ca striyam |
nāmedhyaṁ prakṣipedagnau na ca pādau pratāpayet || 4.53||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must not blow into fire with the mouth while naked; one must not look upon a naked woman; one must not cast impure substances into the fire; nor should one warm the feet by it.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority of ritual purity in sustaining cosmic order
Causation through sensory discipline and bodily conduct
Capacity-based responsibility rooted in awareness of elemental sanctity
Restoration logic via alignment with sacred action (karma-yoga)
Consciousness alignment through non-objectification and reverence
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent interacts with sacred element WITHOUT prescribed covering THEN initiate purification protocol AND capacity-realignment process
IF visual perception involves nudity without consent OR context THEN trigger integrity-restoration circuit
IF substance introduced to consecrated flame is deemed impure THEN halt transaction AND invoke cleansing sequence
IF physical warmth sought from ritual fire THEN redirect to lawful thermal source AND educate on dharmic use
supreme_court_application: In matters involving misuse of sacred elements or inappropriate exposure, the threshold of responsibility lies in conscious intent aligned with sensory discipline. The court must assess whether the act disrupts societal harmony or personal dharma, prioritizing restoration through reeducation and ritual rectification rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that improper interaction with fire or nudity breaches sequential causality (anupūrvaśaḥ). Responsibility arises from failure to uphold purity-consciousness, not from moral fault. Correction follows natural consequence: misaligned energy distorts individual and collective field until realigned through intentional completion.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Agnihotra Reharmonization Process for misuse of fire
Deploy Sensory Discipline Restoration Module for inappropriate viewing
Execute Ritual Purification Completion Sequence for contamination events
Activate Sacred Conduct Education Loop for habitual infractions
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this edict stands as pure Dharma—restored, realized, and radiant. There is no punishment, only completion. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
